intro: Senecio glaucus subsp. cyprius, commonly known as the Cyprus blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing perennial herb with silver-gray foliage due to dense pubescence. The plant produces small, daisy-like yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in summer. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to coastal and arid environments. Its botanical features make it a characteristic species of the Mediterranean flora.
